<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Knights of Lastwall](/Sources.aspx?ID=123) pg. 90</row>

**Price** 1,000 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** held in 1 hand

**Bulk** 1
</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Base Shield** [Wooden Shield](/Shields.aspx?ID=2)
</row>

**Access** Knights of Lastwall have access to this item.

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

Kalabrynne Iomedar commissioned the first of these shields, which have become some of the Shining Sentinels' most valued equipment, replicated among these knights. A shining shield is a seemingly simple [wooden shield](/Shields.aspx?ID=2) (Hardness 6, HP 24, BT 12) with the Shining Oath engraved on the inside.

 While raised, a _shining shield_ moves itself to provide cover for your allies. If you have this shield raised and would provide [cover](/Rules.aspx?ID=459) to an ally against a foe by standing between them, the cover you provide increases one step. Thus, if you were to grant lesser cover, you grant standard cover instead; if you were to grant standard cover, you instead grant greater cover.
